name: Global Governance
description: Terrorism, the proliferation of arms (including weapons of mass destruction), environmental degradation, globalization, technological change, and the rise of non-state actors all pose challenges to statecraft and the management of global order. This seminar course explores the changing dynamics of global politics and the responses to them by states (and others). Topics will include an examination of new forms of international collaboration that have developed in the wake of crises in the years following the Second World War. Not eligible for CR/NCR.
exclusions: Innis One, Munk One, New One, St. Mike's One, Vic One, UC One, Woodsworth One
